q: Which is commonly an ancillary benefit?
explain: Ancillary benefits commonly include dental, vision, life, and disability.
why: Ancillary benefits round out total rewards and improve retention.

q: Which dental design encourages preventive use?
explain: Plans often cover preventive at 100%, basic at 80%, major at 50%.
why: Preventive care reduces downstream high‑cost procedures.

q: Short‑term disability policies usually coordinate with which factor to avoid over‑replacement?
explain: STD benefits often integrate with state DI and employer leave.
why: Proper coordination avoids overpayment disputes and keeps premiums sustainable.

q: What best describes dental waiting period?
choices: time before certain services are covered
explain: Time before certain services are covered.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which statement about annual maximum (dental) is most accurate?
choices: plan cap on paid benefits per year
explain: Plan cap on paid benefits per year.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which scenario aligns with best practice for vision allowance?
explain: Fixed dollar toward frames/lenses.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: What best describes life insurance AD&D?
choices: additional payout for covered accidental death/dis memberment
explain: Additional payout for covered accidental death/dis memberment.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which statement about disability elimination period is most accurate?
choices: time between disability and benefit start
explain: Time between disability and benefit start.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which scenario aligns with best practice for LTD benefit taxability?
choices: depends on who paid premium pre/post‑tax
explain: Depends on who paid premium pre/post‑tax.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: What best describes voluntary benefits?
explain: Employee‑paid optional benefits.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which statement about critical illness policy is most accurate?
choices: lump‑sum on diagnosis of covered condition
explain: Lump‑sum on diagnosis of covered condition.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: Which scenario aligns with best practice for hospital indemnity?
explain: Fixed cash per hospital event.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

q: What best describes EAP?
explain: Confidential assistance services for employees.
why: Understanding ancillary features helps employees use benefits effectively.

choices: time before certain services are covered
explain: Time before certain services are covered.
